title: joker_josue
author: joker_josue
content: The domain bitcointalk.org was registered for the first time on 2011-06-24. Right now 12 Years 4 Month 3 Days.The first record on the Wayback Machine is on July 10, 2011: https://web.archive.org/web/20110701000000*/bitcointalk.orgBut, the topic Welcome to the new Bitcoin forum! created by satoshi dated November 22, 2009.I ask, what was the domain used before bitcointalk.org?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: It was mentioned on the thread you link it is sourceforge.net[1], although it's not a domain, it's like you can create a forum using the sourceforge.net website, which is the very first bitcoin forum.[1] https://bitcoin.sourceforge.net/boards/index.php

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Before bitcointalk.org creation, the forum was hosted on forum.bitcoin.orgRead the old post made by theymos, for more information. Quote from: theymos on February 28, 2015, 06:18:51 AMThe forum was originally located at bitcoin.org/smf, then forum.bitcoin.org (hence the redirect), and finally bitcointalk.org. Quote from: PX-Z on October 28, 2023, 11:19:37 AMIt was mentioned on the thread you link it is sourceforge.net[1], although it's not a domain, it's like you can create a forum using the sourceforge.net website, which is the very first bitcoin forum.As stated by Satoshi in that topic, the sourceforge.net domain was used before creation of the new forum.Note that Satoshi made that topic on November 22, 2009 and bitcointalk.org didn't exist on that date. Satoshi created the forum on forum.bitcoin.org and that's now hosted on bitcointalk.org

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on October 28, 2023, 11:46:20 AMRead the old post made by theymos, for more information. Quote from: theymos on February 28, 2015, 06:18:51 AMThe forum was originally located at bitcoin.org/smf, then forum.bitcoin.org (hence the redirect), and finally bitcointalk.org. I did not know about that post of theymos but now I know it, thanks.Theymos mentioned about it again in 2020 when the owner of forum domain separated from bitcoin.org domain. No cross relationship with Cobra after that.Quote from: theymos on April 17, 2020, 07:13:47 PMSatoshi created both bitcoin.org and this forum, which was originally at bitcoin.org/smf. Later, the forum got its own domain name, but due to this history, bitcoin.org and bitcointalk.org have traditionally been linked ...I am going to update Bitcointalk's important historic changes as I see some new information from you.It's actually there but I hid it in read more.  Quote from: tranthidung on September 23, 2019, 06:23:57 AMForum nameIt was invented by Jeff Garzik who bought the domain. read more

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: You can read this for more info ----> The most iconic bitcointalk threads. History on Bitcointalearly deleted posts ---> https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4715050.msg42617672#msg42617672first 200 topics ---> https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4715050.0Quote from: tranthidung on October 28, 2023, 12:10:14 PMIt's actually there but I hid it in read more.  Quote from: tranthidung on September 23, 2019, 06:23:57 AMForum nameIt was invented by Jeff Garzik who bought the domain. read moreThis is the first time I've heard of this information, and I thought Sirius was the one who bought the domain name.so admin account was run by Satoshi?

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on October 28, 2023, 11:46:20 AMBefore bitcointalk.org creation, the forum was hosted on forum.bitcoin.orgRead the old post made by theymos, for more information. Quote from: theymos on February 28, 2015, 06:18:51 AMThe forum was originally located at bitcoin.org/smf, then forum.bitcoin.org (hence the redirect), and finally bitcointalk.org. Thanks! Do we know the specific reason why this change occurred?Another curiosity, which I found in this research I did, is that in October 2011, there were already more than 40,000 members registered on the forum. Incredible what was accomplished in 2 years.

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on October 28, 2023, 12:29:57 PMQuote from: hosseinimr93 on October 28, 2023, 11:46:20 AMBefore bitcointalk.org creation, the forum was hosted on forum.bitcoin.orgRead the old post made by theymos, for more information. Quote from: theymos on February 28, 2015, 06:18:51 AMThe forum was originally located at bitcoin.org/smf, then forum.bitcoin.org (hence the redirect), and finally bitcointalk.org. Thanks! Do we know the specific reason why this change occurred?In simple words to keep both bitcoin and bitcointalk independent of each other. Simply put after Satoshi three names took over different domains Sirius, Cobra and theymos.As of 2020 theymos have full control of bitcointalk.org and if I’m not wrong bitcoin.org is still in control of Cobra.Similar transition happened with bitcoin core project (wallet software) now the bitcoincoin core is hosted over https://bitcoincore.org/ and Bitcoin.org is suggesting many wallets and among those one is biticoincore.In short bitcointalk.org is for discussion and rich history around bitcoin. No need to link it to bitcoin.org anyway. Bitcoin.org is now more like an information site about “Bitcoin”.And Bitcoincore about open source project maintaining bitcoin client software.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on October 28, 2023, 12:21:32 PMThis is the first time I've heard of this information, and I thought Sirius was the one who bought the domain name.First topics of the forum created by the admin account (for testing, topic 1, 2) and Satoshi Nakamoto (topic 4). Read them in the staff forum: https://bitcointalk.org/first_topics/The topic 3 was deleted because it contains information about Satoshi Nakamoto.Quoteso admin account was run by Satoshi? From the post of theymos, Satoshi Nakamoto created the forum and it means Satoshi Nakamoto run the admin account but you always can wonder what is the truth.Quote from: shahzadafzal on October 28, 2023, 01:18:00 PMIn simple words to keep both bitcoin and bitcointalk independent of each other. Simply put after Satoshi three names took over different domains Sirius, Cobra and theymos.As of 2020 theymos have full control of bitcointalk.org and if I’m not wrong bitcoin.org is still in control of Cobra.Theymos announced the domain name update and explained why theymos did it.Quote from: theymos on April 17, 2020, 07:13:47 PMSatoshi created both bitcoin.org and this forum, which was originally at bitcoin.org/smf. Later, the forum got its own domain name, but due to this history, bitcoin.org and bitcointalk.org have traditionally been linked, and for quite some time Cøbra and I have together managed the domain names. However, Cøbra has never had much involvement in bitcointalk.org's operation, and I haven't involved myself in bitcoin.org for a couple of years, so the linkage between the two no longer really made made any sense. Therefore, we decided to separate the domains: I no longer have any access to the bitcoin.org domain name, and Cøbra no longer has any access to the bitcointalk.org domain name. The two sites should be viewed as totally separate, which in practice they have been for years.There will be no changes whatsoever on bitcointalk.org due to this, and I'd assume that the same will be true of bitcoin.org. The bitcoin.org open-source project has been advancing steadily, and I hope and expect that it will continue to do so thanks to the efforts of its contributors.Thanks to Cøbra for handling much of bitcointalk.org's domain-name-related work in the past.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: joker_josue on October 28, 2023, 12:29:57 PMDo we know the specific reason why this change occurred?There was a discussion about that among bitcoin developers and they decided to do so. For more information, read the topic created by theymos. Forum moved to bitcointalk.orgI just made a search and I think low value topics was what caused developers to make such decision.Visit this thread: Why is this forum considered terrible by our development overlords?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on October 28, 2023, 11:46:20 AMBefore bitcointalk.org creation, the forum was hosted on forum.bitcoin.org....Thanks for the correction, i tried to find the archive page of the forum but no avail, even in the bitcoin.org or in sourceforge.net. I'm quite interested on how the forum looks way back then though. This [1] is the only the oldest archive recorded of bitcoin.org but not included the first forum look.[1] https://archive.is/https://bitcoin.org/

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on October 28, 2023, 04:29:59 PMThanks for the correction, i tried to find the archive page of the forum but no avail, even in the bitcoin.org or in sourceforge.net. You can see many captures taken from forum.bitcoin.org on wayback machine. Click here. It seems that the forum was like the current version when it was hosted on forum.bitcoin.org. Quote from: PX-Z on October 28, 2023, 04:29:59 PMThis [1] is the only the oldest archive recorded of bitcoin.org but not included the first forum look.The forum was hosted on forum.bitcoin.org and that's what you should have searched for. Bitcoin.org still exists, but the forum was moved from forum.bitcoin.org to bitcointalk.org.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on October 28, 2023, 05:01:19 PMQuote from: PX-Z on October 28, 2023, 04:29:59 PMThanks for the correction, i tried to find the archive page of the forum but no avail, even in the bitcoin.org or in sourceforge.net. You can see many captures taken from forum.bitcoin.org on wayback machine. Click here. It seems that the forum was like the current version when it was hosted on forum.bitcoin.org. Quote from: PX-Z on October 28, 2023, 04:29:59 PMThis [1] is the only the oldest archive recorded of bitcoin.org but not included the first forum look.The forum was hosted on forum.bitcoin.org and that's what you should have searched for. Bitcoin.org still exists, but the forum was moved from forum.bitcoin.org to bitcointalk.org. it does mean that Theymos also owns bitcoin.org correct?2011 still is the time when people are building wordpress sites and forums to monetize. i couldn't be sure but i think there was a time in the past when Theymos uses adsense in bitcointalk. which i guess is the reason for moving it from the subforum to a new domain.Roger Ver was finding issues about this so he created his own forum. but like it was said above, the forum started on sourceforge where Satoshi made his first post.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on October 28, 2023, 05:01:19 PMIt seems that the forum was like the current version when it was hosted on forum.bitcoin.org. Yeah, it really looks like the same and it's just migrated from another domain to another.Quote from: electronicash on October 28, 2023, 05:21:10 PMit does mean that Theymos also owns bitcoin.org correct?That was before, both with cobra, this forum and the bitcoin.org. But now cobra completely have full control the bitcoin.org while theymos have full control the forum host and domain.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on October 28, 2023, 05:25:18 PMQuote from: electronicash on October 28, 2023, 05:21:10 PMit does mean that Theymos also owns bitcoin.org correct?That was before, both with cobra, this forum and the bitcoin.org. But now cobra completely have full control the bitcoin.org while theymos have full control the forum host and domain.I find the succession leading to being the admin of Bitcointalk.org very interesting, Theymos was just one of the global moderators then he became one of the admins then all the other admins left and he is the only one who remained so he became the head of Bitcointalk, it's by fate that he become the head of Bitcointalk and so far Bitcointalk is doing great supporting Bitcointalk advancement and enlightenment.I believe for security reasons and the continuation of Bitcointalk there's also a succession of who will own the domain in case, I hope the admins will inform us if there are new changes.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: robelneo on October 29, 2023, 10:36:29 PMTheymos was just one of the global moderators then he became one of the admins then all the other admins left and he is the only one who remained so he became the head of Bitcointalk, it's by fate that he become the head of Bitcointalk and so far Bitcointalk is doing great supporting Bitcointalk advancement and enlightenment.That's always the nature of having a community forum, next time there will be new promoted admin besides cyrus from being a moderator. But since theymos is just like in his 30s i guess we will still see him as the head for several years unless he resign early and pass his reign.
